results.title: Is beta-blocker (atenolol) a preferred antihypertensive in acute intracerebral hemorrhage?
results.text_hl: Use of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ in @DISEASE_Intracranial_Hemorrhage_Hypertensive @DISEASE_MESH:D020299 @@@hypertensive ICH@@@ results in reduction in mortality, @<m>DISEASE_Systemic_Inflammatory_Response_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018746 @@@SIRS@@@, and @DISEASE_Pneumonia @DISEASE_MESH:D011014 @@@pneumonia@@@ which may be due to its beta-adrenergic blocking effect.

citations.NLM: Kalita J, Misra UK, Kumar B. Is beta-blocker (atenolol) a preferred antihypertensive in acute intracerebral hemorrhage? Neurol Sci. 2013 Jul;34(7):1099-104. PMID: 23053838
